poem:
Locked In

The bars grow thicker,  
men pile high—  
a leaning tower of dreams.

Once,  
we spoke of freedom,  
now measured  
in steel and stone.

A nation mirrors its past,  
a stubborn gate holds firm.  
Future whispers now,  
against the clang of time.
